page.title: 16A Local Figure
page.content: In 1539 after the Dissolution,Sir John Kingsmill,a Basingstoke man was granted Sydmonton Manor by Henry VIII for his loyal service.High Sheriff of Hampshire,chief magistrate and bailiff of Basingstoke,he became resident at Sydmonton.His descendants have given distinguished service to the country for four centuries in law,education, parliament and royal service.During the 18th century early deaths greatly reduced direct descendants,and in the 19th century the manor devolved upon William Stevens Kingsmill and then to Lt.Col.Kingsmill the present owner's uncle.{Charles Clifford-Kingsmill}is following the tradition of his family, a captain in the Inniskilling Dragoon Guards,a governor of Ecchinswell Primary School,chairman of St.Gabriel's School and president of Kingsclere British Legion.
